owner.username: Galt Museum & Archives on The Commons

title._content: Crowd gathered in front of bandstand in Galt Park

description._content: ca. 1910-12 8.9 x 14 cm Set of 10 color tinted postcards [19841068000] Acquisition Source laPlante, Kathleen F. The souvenir booklet originally belonged to Louis P. la Plante, father-in-law of the donor. He worked in Montreal circa 1925-26, and it's believed he purchased the postcards at that time to take back to his home in Auburn, Massachusetts. The set included: 1 General view of Galt Park. 2 Crowd gathered in front of band stand in Galt park. 3 Harness race at Exhibition Grounds 4 North side of 4th Avenue South, looking east from 6th Street. Court house and City Offices visible. 5 View of the river valley and High Level Bridge 6 Cadets parading along 5th Street South between 3rd and 4th Avenue 7 Lethbridge Collieries, No. 6 Mine 8 north side of 3rd Avenue South near 8th Street. Wesley Church and Hull Block visible. 9 Traffic bridge across Oldman River 10 Galt Hospital, opened in 1910. To obtain high quality and larger reproductions of this image please visit the Galt Museum & Archives website: www.galtmuseum.com/archives.htm and include thIs number in your request: 19841068002
